title: What's the point of Hail of Blades?
body:
https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-qMvKxlYIv2M/Wut2QWZb0QI/AAAAAAAA-5A/IIHuwtvVk8wZ6_-tot81Rf6w4rSsNi66QCLcBGAs/s1600/hailofblades.jpg

If it's only going to be used by a small pool of champions? (Ex: {{champion:5}} example provided by Riot) It's going to be like the Rune Predator upon release that was only picked for Hecarim at first, it's still quite an underpicked Rune when compared to other Runes since only currently (Warwick - sometimes, Rammus - rarely, Annie - by Anniebot, and Nunu) use it.

Many others have also said that Attack Speed based Rune doesn't belong in the Domination path, and I agree.

When I heard of a new Rune that was going to be released I was really excited, but later on I was a bit disappointed with the current outcome. It's literally just a renamed Lethal Tempo combined with Press the Attack mechanic. I mean really Riot? There were so many other options that could of been considered. If there was a struggle to figure what Rune to give to the Domination Path why not give other Paths Runes (that need them) that you might or might not have ideas for while you come up with something to add to the Domination Path.

I know for a fact that a lot of players miss Deathfire Touch, and we were told by Riot that it was replaced by Aery but that Rune feels more targeted towards supports or Enchanters in particular (also what many people on boards have said).

If they wanted burst with a dash/stealth, wouldn't you get more value of an electrocute proc or dark harvest stack then just autoing faster 3 times? 

In electro v. hail, 3 attacks to free burst damage that scales with your AD/AP vs. just attacking 3 times but  faster. Which sounds more appealing?

Unless your name is twitch then this doesn't seem worth  it to me over the other keystone options, even with electro you get better cheese potential to snowball.

I've seen some compare it to other keystones while holding back some crucial details.

**Domination keystones:**
Electrocute has a way longer cooldown.
Dark Harvest requires time to stack up.
Predator requires boots, has a long cooldown and has a short channel time.
This keystone is the first in the domination tree that can actively be used in the laning phase.

**Precision keystones:**
PTA requires 3 basic attacks in order to activate, only you third attack and onward will take advantage of this rune. _Doesn't give AS_
Lethal Tempo is in this regard quite similar but activates after 1.5 seconds, so a little less front loaded but much more backloaded.
Conqueror: Gated behind preparation and gives AD instead of AS, total effect will probably be more damage though.
But moreover, these keystones are in the precision tree, which give attack speed instead of damage.

I think this keystone is better suited for fighters/bruisers that want quick trades.
Especially during the laning phase this rune will be impactful. Late game where the fights against durable opponents are more drawn out, this won't be as useful as some other keystones. It probably neither will be as useful as Electrocute when you have to quickly dispose of a single enemy.

The goal is to open up diferent tree combinations.
The introduction of this keystone makes the tree more appealing to a bigger breadth  of champions and gives champions that already like thw teee more options to consider.

Along with the new Stormrazor, and lE changes, i can see it being appealing for assassins or bruisers that wanna opt for a more DPS ish leaning build that helps with splitpushing and gives them some wiggle room against tanks at the cost of less immediate squishy killing power.

To go through your list in order:

Darius maybe gets an extra AA. He needs to use his W slow to position his Q, and without using the W slow - which is already an AA reset - he doesn't have the sticking power to lay down repeated autos. You're going to waste 1 attack because of the AA reset at the best of times.

Trynd, Aatrox might but probably benefit more from PTA/Conq. Probably benefits more from PTA/Conq but we'll see.

Camille is a caster reliant on specific empowered auto attacks. She has 0 synergy with this rune other than negligible magic damage on hit from her ult - which is around 4% of her total damage to champions (source: https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/platinum/plus/champion/Camille/)

Kled gets his W burst off faster, but his problem has always been killing things that don't die to W, rather than not being able to get W off. Kled needs to burst harder - not faster - in his runes, so won't take this.

Olaf uses predator for target access in the jungle, and comet for lane advantage top lane. I don't see this being better than those options. PTA already gives him the option of damage if he wants it and is probably better than this.

Volibear uses predator for target access in the jungle, and has options for Aftershock and PTA already (Grasp top lane). His auto-attacks are not individually powerful (which they need to be for attack-speed to be worthwhile). 

Xin is about the only champion I actually can see taking this rune as it lets him get his Q combo off faster for burst damage when ganking. 

Why would Yorick, a caster reliant on damage inflicted by his ghouls/maiden ever want attack speed?

Fail of Blades indeed seems to be lost in terms of identity. I think its overall power level is unusually low for every class and I think its too similar to certain other keystones. 

Suggestion: rework to each basic attack increases ability damage by X% and stack up Y times. This way some mages can use it, adcs, some assassins, I bet fighters might especially like it. Numbers can always be chosen to be appropriate.

{{champion:56}}  is going to love this shit.

His strongest build is assassin one-shot, but he still needs attack speed (it generally takes 2 actual attacks). This rune will let him skimp on attack speed and unload a disgusting amount of burst as soon as he impacts someone.

Depending on how it synergizes with Stormrazor, it could be even better than I'm imagining.

to proc kindred e faster eggsde

It's honestly probably not that bad. You benefit from every tier of Domination and can still secondary down Precision to get the runes that matter. Kindred highest pickrate is Precision+Domination anyway. It's not like it is going to be a completely troll pick compared to PtA depending on the scenario. If you REALLY need the damage amp to kill a tankier target then yeah, take PtA, but if the enemy team doesn't have a super tank OR if you have someone on your team who is already going to take PtA (which could potentially be almost every ADC depending on how hard Fleet gets nerfed), then this is honestly a fairly good option. Starting the fight triple critting someone late game as Kindred from REALLY far away REALLY fast is potentially REALLY good. Also, probably does better in ganks since chances are you are getting disengaged off of before you can utilize the damage amp from PtA meaning getting a potentially 2 extra autos off in the gank could be more worthwhile than getting 1 amped auto or whatever.
